p: Human coronaviruses were for the first time isolated from a patient with acute respiratory diseases in 1965 (Hamre and Procknow 1966; Tyrrell and Bynoe 1966). Their characteristic corona seen under the electronic microscope was reflected in the name coronaviruses (Tyrrell etÂ al. 1975). During the next three decades (until the pandemic strains appeared), the coronaviruses were not of any special interest for most scientists.
